pullRequest.body:
Define a typeclass `Differential` of `CommRing`s with a chosen `Derivation`, a notation for that derivation, and a `DifferentialAlgebra` for `Algerba`s on differential rings whose `algebraMap` commutes with the derivation.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [487dac828a](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14699/commits/487dac828a1dac1c9e0db01e98ebac7d21d89c10)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.Derivation.DifferentialRing`|965|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Differential`
`+ Differential.ContainConstants`
`+ Differential.equiv`
`+ DifferentialAlgebra`
`+ DifferentialAlgebra.equiv`
`+ algebraMap.coe_deriv`
`+ delabDeriv`
`+ instance (A : Type*) [CommRing A] [Differential A] : Differential.ContainConstants A A`
`+ instance (A : Type*) [CommRing A] [Differential A] : DifferentialAlgebra A A`
`+ mem_range_of_deriv_eq_zero`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:

```
</details>
The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
Is there a problem with the instance I add?
Do you plan to add more results about this? Please move it into a new file in that case.

> Do you plan to add more results about this? Please move it into a new file in that case.

A few more, proving that `AlgHom`s commute with the derivative in some cases. What's a good name for this file?
`RingTheory/Derivation/DifferentialRing` or `RingTheory/DifferentialRing` both makes sense IMO.
How would `class DifferentialRing (R : Type*) [CommRing R] where` help for having multiple derivatives?

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10519586704/job/29147174477)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10519586704/job/29147174343)

My apologies for the delay in reviewing. Holiday season etc...

I think this looks good now.

bors merge

My apologies for the delay in reviewing. Holiday season etc...

I think this looks good now.

bors merge
Is this still necessary?
I tried removing it, let's see if it works
Are there any non-commutative `CommDifferentialRing`s?
I'm not aware of any, the existing definition of Derivation requires commutativity, and Wikipedia defines it with commutativity, but I don't know differential algebra well enough to tell for sure.

Would you ever want to consider multiple differential-ring structures on the same ring (maybe multiple partial derivatives)? If so, I would suggest `class DifferentialRing (R : Type*) [CommRing R] where` instead.

You could have multiple `(d1 d2 : DifferentialRing R)` lying around, like how mathlib deals with multiple topologies on a type. Also you wouldn't be able to declare differential fields with this bundled approach.
I would (and do, in #14860), they just extend both `CommDifferentialRing` and `Field`
I tried to change it, what do you think? It's nicer in some ways, but it also requires writing more typeclass assumptions

```suggestion
scoped[DifferentialRing] postfix:max "′" => CommDifferentialRing.deriv

open scoped DifferentialRing
```

```suggestion
@[reducible]
def CommDifferentialRing.equiv {R R2 : Type*} [CommRing R] [CommDifferentialRing R2] (h : R ≃+* R2):
```
see library note [reducible non-instances].

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
@[reducible]
def DifferentialAlgebra.equiv {A : Type*} [CommDifferentialRing A]
```

```suggestion
A differential ring `A` and an algebra over it `B` share constants if all
```
Also I would suggest the following instead
```
class CommDifferentialRing.ContainConstants (A B : Type*) [CommRing A] [CommDifferentialRing B]
    [Algebra A B] : Prop where
  /-- If the derivative of x is 0, then it's in the range of `algberaMap A B`. -/
  protected mem_range_of_deriv_eq_zero {x : B} (h : x′ = 0) : x ∈ (algebraMap A B).range
```
Could you please turn the `2` into a subscript? Type `\2` in VSCode to get the unicode subscript version.

```suggestion
/-- Transfer a `Differential` instance accross a `RingEquiv`. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- A derivation from a ring to itself, as a typeclass. -/
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/Derivation): define `Differential` and `DifferentialAlgebra` typeclasses
